00019 /*
00020  * This is a simple JSON-RPC server.  We receive a service name in
00021  * dot-separated path format and expect to find the class containing the
00022  * service in a file of the service name (with dots converted to slashes and
00023  * ".php" appended).
00024  */
00025 
00026 require "JSON.phps";
00027 
00028 /*
00029  * There may be cases where all services need use of some libraries or
00030  * system-wide definitions.  Those may be provided by a file named
00031  * "global_settings.php" in the same directory as this file.  If it exists, we
00032  * include it.
00033  *
00034  * The global settings file may provide values for the following manifest
00035  * constants whose default values are otherwise provided below:
00036  *
00037  *   servicePathPrefix
00038  *   defaultAccessibility
00039  *
00040  */
00041 if (file_exists("global_settings.php"))
00042 {
00043     require "global_settings.php";
00044 }
00045 
00049 define("servicePathPrefix",                "");
00050 
00051 
00052 
00053 /*
00054  * Method Accessibility values
00055  *
00056  * Possible values are:
00057  *
00058  *   "public" -
00059  *     The method may be called from any session, and without any checking of
00060  *     who the Referer is.
00061  *
00062  *   "domain" -
00063  *     The method may only be called by a script obtained via a web page
00064  *     loaded from this server.  The Referer must match the request URI,
00065  *     through the domain part.
00066  *
00067  *   "session" -
00068  *     The Referer must match the Referer of the very first RPC request
00069  *     issued during the session.
00070  *
00071  *   "fail" -
00072  *     Access is denied
00073  */
00074 define("Accessibility_Public",             "public");
00075 define("Accessibility_Domain",             "domain");
00076 define("Accessibility_Session",            "session");
00077 define("Accessibility_Fail",               "fail");
00078 
00082 define("defaultAccessibility",             Accessibility_Domain);
00083 
00084 
00085 
00089 define("JsonRpcError_Origin_Server",      1);
00090 define("JsonRpcError_Origin_Application", 2);
00091 define("JsonRpcError_Origin_Transport",   3); // never generated by server
00092 define("JsonRpcError_Origin_Client",      4); // never generated by server
00093 
00094 
00095 /*
00096  * JSON-RPC server-generated error codes
00097  */
00098 
00099 /*
00100  * Error code, value -1: Script Error
00101  *
00102  * This error is raised when the service class aborts with an error,
00103  * either syntax (parsing) errors or runtime exceptions.
00104  *
00105  * Although in PHP, it is possible to raise a custom error using the
00106  * trigger_error() function, that technique is strongly discouraged when
00107  * using JSON RPC; rather, return an appropriate application-specific error
00108  * code to the client, with additional descriptive text in the JsonRpcError
00109  * message.  An error generated with trigger_error() will always yield an
00110  * error with origin=Server, code=ScriptError which makes it difficult for the
00111  * client application to ascertain what went wrong.  This is particularly
00112  * important when the application is to be localized, as it would never
00113  * display a message directly from the server, but instead display its own
00114  * message based on the error code.
00115  */
00116 define("JsonRpcError_ScriptError",    -1);
00117 
00124 define("JsonRpcError_Unknown",      0);
00125 
00132 define("JsonRpcError_IllegalService",      1);
00133 
00139 define("JsonRpcError_ServiceNotFound",     2);
00140 
00149 define("JsonRpcError_ClassNotFound",       3);
00150 
00156 define("JsonRpcError_MethodNotFound",      4);
00157 
00165 define("JsonRpcError_ParameterMismatch",   5);
00166 
00176 define("JsonRpcError_PermissionDenied",    6);
00177 
00178 define("ScriptTransport_NotInUse",         -1);
00179 
00180 
00181 function SendReply($reply, $scriptTransportId)
00182 {
00183     /* If not using ScriptTransport... */
00184     if ($scriptTransportId == ScriptTransport_NotInUse)
00185     {
00186         /* ... then just output the reply. */
00187         print $reply;
00188     }
00189     else
00190     {
00191         /* Otherwise, we need to add a call to a qooxdoo-specific function */
00192         $reply =
00193             "qcl.remote.ScriptTransport._requestFinished(" .
00194             $scriptTransportId . ", " . $reply .
00195             ");";
00196         print $reply;
00197     }
00198 }
00199 
00200 
00201 /*
00202  * class JsonRpcError
00203  *
00204  * This class allows service methods to easily provide error information for
00205  * return via JSON-RPC.
00206  */
00207 class JsonRpcError
00208 {
00209     var             $json;
00210     var             $data;
00211     var             $id;
00212     var             $scriptTransportId;
00213     
00214     function JsonRpcError($json,
00215                           $origin = JsonRpcError_Origin_Server,
00216                           $code = JsonRpcError_Unknown,
00217                           $message = "Unknown error")
00218     {
00219         $this->json = $json;
00220         $this->data = array("origin"  => $origin,
00221                             "code"    => $code,
00222                             "message" => $message);
00223 
00224         /* Assume we're not using ScriptTransporrt */
00225         $this->scriptTransportId = ScriptTransport_NotInUse;
00226     }
00227     
00228     function SetOrigin($origin)
00229     {
00230         $this->data["origin"] = $origin;
00231     }
00232 
00233     function SetError($code, $message)
00234     {
00235         $this->data["code"] = $code;
00236         $this->data["message"] = $message;
00237     }
00238     
00239     function SetId($id)
00240     {
00241         $this->id = $id;
00242     }
00243     
00244     function SetScriptTransportId($id)
00245     {
00246         $this->scriptTransportId = $id;
00247     }
00248     
00249     function SendAndExit()
00250     {
00251         $error = $this;
00252         $id = $this->id;
00253         $ret = array("error" => $this->data,
00254                      "id"    => $id);
00255         SendReply($this->json->encode($ret), $this->scriptTransportId);
00256         exit;
00257     }
00258 }
00259 
00260 function debug($str)
00261 {
00262     static $fw = null;
00263     if ($fw === null)
00264     {
00265         $fw = fopen("/tmp/phpinfo", "a");
00266     }
00267     fputs($fw, $str, strlen($str));
00268     fflush($fw);
00269 }
00270 
00271 //=================================================================
00272 // error handling for jsonrpc 
00273 // contributed by Christian Boulanger (info at bibliograph dot org)
00274 //
00275 // The main idea of this code is to keep PHP from messing up the 
00276 // JSONRPC response if a parsing or runtime error occurs, and to 
00277 // allow the client application to handle those errors nicely
00278 //=================================================================
00279 
00285 if (! defined("JsonRpcErrorHandling"))
00286 {
00287     define("JsonRpcErrorHandling",             "on");
00288 }
00289 
00297 function jsonrpc_catch_errors($buffer)
00298 {
00299     if (ereg("(error</b>:)(.+)(<br)", $buffer, $regs) ) 
00300     {
00301         // parse error string from PHP error message 
00302         $err = preg_replace("/<.*?>/","",$regs[2]);
00303 
00304         // return error formatted as a JSONRPC error response
00305         return
00306             '{' .
00307             '  error:' .
00308             '  {' .
00309             '    "origin":' . JsonRpcError_Origin_Server . ',' . 
00310             '    "code":' .  JsonRpcError_ScriptError . ',' .
00311             '    "message":"Fatal PHP Error: '. addslashes($err) .
00312             ' "}' .
00313             '}';
00314     } 
00315     else
00316     {
00317         // Buffer does not contain a php error message, so return it
00318         // unmodified.
00319         return $buffer;
00320     }
00321 }
00322 
00323 
00327 function jsonRpcErrorHandler($errno, $errstr, $errfile, $errline)
00328 {
00329     // determine error type
00330     // todo: remove those which are not captured by set_error_handler()
00331     switch($errno){
00332     case E_ERROR:
00333         $errtype= "Error";
00334         break;
00335         
00336     case E_WARNING:
00337         $errtype= "Warning";
00338         break;
00339         
00340     case E_PARSE:
00341         $errtype= "Parse Error";
00342         break;
00343         
00344     case E_NOTICE:
00345         $errtype= "Notice";
00346         break;
00347         
00348     case E_CORE_ERROR:
00349         $errtype= "Core Error";
00350         break;
00351         
00352     case E_CORE_WARNING:
00353         $errtype= "Core Warning";
00354         break;
00355         
00356     case E_COMPILE_ERROR:
00357         $errtype= "Compile Error";
00358         break;
00359         
00360     case E_COMPILE_WARNING:
00361         $errtype= "Compile Warning";
00362         break;
00363         
00364     case E_USER_ERROR:
00365         $errtype= "User Error";
00366         break;
00367         
00368     case E_USER_WARNING:
00369         $errtype= "User Warning";
00370         break;
00371         
00372     case E_USER_NOTICE:
00373         $errtype= "User Notice";
00374         break;
00375         
00376     case E_STRICT:
00377         $errtype= "Strict Notice";
00378         break;
00379         
00380     case E_RECOVERABLE_ERROR:
00381         $errtype= "Recoverable Error";
00382         break;
00383         
00384     default:
00385         $errtype= "Unknown error ($errno)";
00386         break;
00387     }   
00388     
00389     // respect error_reporting level
00390     $errno = $errno & error_reporting();
00391     if($errno == 0) return true;
00392     
00393     $errmsg =   "PHP $errtype in $errfile, line $errline: $errstr";
00394 
00395     // if not called through jsonrpc request
00396     global $error;
00397     if (! is_object($error))
00398     {
00399         echo nl2br($errmsg);
00400         exit(1);
00401     }
00402         
00403     // return jsonrpc error
00404     $error->SetError($errno, $errmsg);
00405     $error->SendAndExit();
00406 
00407     // never gets here
00408 }
00409 
00413 if (JsonRpcErrorHandling == "on")
00414 {
00415     // start buffering to catch errors with handler function
00416     ob_start("jsonrpc_catch_errors");
00417         
00418     // This will not always work, so do some more hacking to comment out
00419     // uncaught errors.  You'll need to examine the http response to see
00420     // the uncaught errors!
00421     ini_set('error_prepend_string', "/*");
00422     ini_set('error_append_string', "*/");
00423         
00424     // error handler function for php jsonrpc
00425     set_error_handler("jsonRpcErrorHandler");   
00426 }
00427 
00428 //==========================================================
00429 // end error handling code
00430 //==========================================================
00431 
00432 /*
00433  * Start or join an existing session
00434  */
00435 session_start();
00436 
00437 /*
00438  * Create a new instance of JSON and get the JSON-RPC request from
00439  * the POST data.
00440  */
00441 $json = new JSON();
00442 $error = new JsonRpcError($json);
00443 
00444 /* Assume (default) we're not using ScriptTransport */
00445 $scriptTransportId = ScriptTransport_NotInUse;
00446 
00447 if ($_SERVER["REQUEST_METHOD"] == "POST")
00448 {
00449     /*
00450      * For POST data, the only acceptable content type is application/json.
00451      */
00452     switch($_SERVER["CONTENT_TYPE"])
00453     {
00454     case "application/json":
00455         /* We found literal POSTed json-rpc data (we hope) */
00456         $input = file_get_contents('php://input');
00457         $jsonInput = $json->decode($input);
00458         break;
00459     
00460     default:
00461         /*
00462          * This request was not issued with JSON-RPC so echo the error rather
00463          * than issuing a JsonRpcError response.
00464          */
00465         echo
00466             "JSON-RPC request expected; " .
00467             "unexpected data received";
00468         exit;
00469     }
00470 }
00471 else if ($_SERVER["REQUEST_METHOD"] == "GET" &&
00472          isset($_GET["_ScriptTransport_id"]) &&
00473          $_GET["_ScriptTransport_id"] != ScriptTransport_NotInUse &&
00474          isset($_GET["_ScriptTransport_data"]))
00475 {
00476     /* We have what looks like a valid ScriptTransport request */
00477     $scriptTransportId = $_GET["_ScriptTransport_id"];
00478     $error->SetScriptTransportId($scriptTransportId);
00479     $input = $_GET["_ScriptTransport_data"];
00480     $jsonInput = $json->decode(get_magic_quotes_gpc()
00481                                ? stripslashes($input)
00482                                : $input);
00483 }
00484 else
00485 {
00486     /*
00487      * This request was not issued with JSON-RPC so echo the error rather than
00488      * issuing a JsonRpcError response.
00489      */
00490     echo "Services require JSON-RPC<br>";
00491     exit;
00492 }
00493 
00494 /* Ensure that this was a JSON-RPC service request */
00495 if (! isset($jsonInput) ||
00496     ! isset($jsonInput->service) ||
00497     ! isset($jsonInput->method) ||
00498     ! isset($jsonInput->params))
00499 {
00500     /*
00501      * This request was not issued with JSON-RPC so echo the error rather than
00502      * issuing a JsonRpcError response.
00503      */
00504     echo
00505         "JSON-RPC request expected; " .
00506         "service, method or params missing<br>";
00507     exit;
00508 }
00509 
00510 /*
00511  * Ok, it looks like JSON-RPC, so we'll return an Error object if we encounter
00512  * errors from here on out.
00513  */
00514 $error->SetId($jsonInput->id);
00515 
00516 /*
00517  * Ensure the requested service name is kosher.  A service name should be:
00518  *
00519  *   - a dot-separated sequences of strings; no adjacent dots
00520  *   - first character of each string is in [a-zA-Z] 
00521  *   - other characters are in [_a-zA-Z0-9]
00522  */
00523 
00524 /* First check for legal characters */
00525 if (ereg("^[_.a-zA-Z0-9]+$", $jsonInput->service) === false)
00526 {
00527     /* There's some illegal character in the service name */
00528     $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_IllegalService,
00529                      "Illegal character found in service name.");
00530     $error->SendAndExit();
00531     /* never gets here */
00532 }
00533 
00534 /* Now ensure there are no double dots */
00535 if (strstr($jsonInput->service, "..") !== false)
00536 {
00537     $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_IllegalService,
00538                      "Illegal use of two consecutive dots in service name");
00539     $error->SendAndExit();
00540 }
00541 
00542 /* Explode the service name into its dot-separated parts */
00543 $serviceComponents = explode(".", $jsonInput->service);
00544 
00545 /* Ensure that each component begins with a letter */
00546 for ($i = 0; $i < count($serviceComponents); $i++)
00547 {
00548     if (ereg("^[a-zA-Z]", $serviceComponents[$i]) === false)
00549     {
00550         $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_IllegalService,
00551                          "A service name component does not begin with a letter");
00552         $error->SendAndExit();
00553         /* never gets here */
00554     }
00555 }
00556 
00557 /*
00558  * Now replace all dots with slashes so we can locate the service script.  We
00559  * also retain the exploded components of the path, as the class name of the
00560  * service is the last component of the path.
00561  */
00562 $servicePath = implode("/", $serviceComponents);
00563 
00564 /* Try to load the requested service */
00565 if ( ! file_exists( servicePathPrefix . $servicePath . ".php") )
00566 {
00567     /* Couldn't find the requested service */
00568     $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_ServiceNotFound,
00569                      "Service `$servicePath` not found.");
00570     $error->SendAndExit();
00571     /* never gets here */
00572 }
00573 require servicePathPrefix . $servicePath . ".php";
00574 
00575 /* The service class is the last component of the service name */
00576 $className = "class_" . $serviceComponents[count($serviceComponents) - 1];
00577 
00578 /* Ensure that the class exists */
00579 if (! class_exists($className))
00580 {
00581     $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_ClassNotFound,
00582                      "Service class `" .
00583                      $serviceComponents[count($serviceComponents) - 1] .
00584                      "` not found.");
00585     $error->SendAndExit();
00586     /* never gets here */
00587 }
00588 
00589 /* Instantiate the service */
00590 $service = new $className();
00591 
00592 /*
00593  * Do referer checking.  There is a global default which can be overridden by
00594  * each service for a specified method.
00595  */
00596 
00597 /* Assign the default accessibility */
00598 $accessibility = defaultAccessibility;
00599 
00600 /*
00601  * See if there is a "GetAccessibility" method in the class.  If there is, it
00602  * should take two parameters: the method name and the default accessibility,
00603  * and return one of the Accessibililty values.
00604  */
00605 if (method_exists($service, "GetAccessibility"))
00606 {
00607     /* Yup, there is.  Get the accessibility for the requested method */
00608     $accessibility = $service->GetAccessibility($jsonInput->method,
00609                                                 $accessibility);
00610 }
00611 
00612 /* Do the accessibility test. */
00613 switch($accessibility)
00614 {
00615 case Accessibility_Public:
00616     /* Nothing to do.  The method is accessible. */
00617     break;
00618     
00619 case Accessibility_Domain:
00620     /* Determine the protocol used for the request */
00621     if (isset($_SERVER["SSL_PROTOCOL"]))
00622     {
00623         $requestUriDomain = "https://";
00624     }
00625     else
00626     {
00627         $requestUriDomain = "http://";
00628     }
00629 
00630     // Add the server name
00631     $requestUriDomain .= $_SERVER["SERVER_NAME"];
00632 
00633     // The port number optionally follows.  We don't know if they manually
00634     // included the default port number, so we just have to assume they
00635     // didn't.
00636     if ((! isset($_SERVER["SSL_PROTOCOL"]) && $_SERVER["SERVER_PORT"] != 80) ||
00637         (  isset($_SERVER["SSL_PROTOCOL"]) && $_SERVER["SERVER_PORT"] != 443))
00638     {
00639         // Non-default port number, so append it.
00640         $requestUriDomain .= ":" . $_SERVER["SERVER_PORT"];
00641     }
00642 
00643     /* Get the Referer, up through the domain part */
00644     if (ereg("^(https?://[^/]*)", $_SERVER["HTTP_REFERER"], $regs) === false)
00645     {
00646         /* unrecognized referer */
00647         $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_PermissionDenied,
00648                          "Permission Denied [2]");
00649         $error->SendAndExit();
00650         /* never gets here */
00651     }
00652 
00653     /* Retrieve the referer component */
00654     $refererDomain = $regs[1];
00655 
00656     /* Is the method accessible? */
00657     if ($refererDomain != $requestUriDomain)
00658     {
00659         /* Nope. */
00660         $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_PermissionDenied,
00661                          "Permission Denied [3]");
00662         $error->SendAndExit();
00663         /* never gets here */
00664     }
00665 
00666     /* If no referer domain has yet been saved in the session... */
00667     if (! isset($_SESSION["session_referer_domain"]))
00668     {
00669         /* ... then set it now using this referer domain. */
00670         $_SESSION["session_referer_domain"] = $refererDomain;
00671     }
00672     break;
00673     
00674 case Accessibility_Session:
00675     /* Get the Referer, up through the domain part */
00676     if (ereg("(((http)|(https))://[^/]*)(.*)",
00677              $_SERVER["HTTP_REFERER"],
00678              $regs) === false)
00679     {
00680         /* unrecognized referer */
00681         $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_PermissionDenied,
00682                          "Permission Denied [4]");
00683         $error->SendAndExit();
00684         /* never gets here */
00685     }
00686 
00687     /* Retrieve the referer component */
00688     $refererDomain = $regs[1];
00689 
00690     /* Is the method accessible? */
00691     if (isset($_SESSION["session_referer_domain"]) &&
00692         $refererDomain != $_SESSION["session_referer_domain"])
00693     {
00694         /* Nope. */
00695         $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_PermissionDenied,
00696                          "Permission Denied [5]");
00697         $error->SendAndExit();
00698         /* never gets here */
00699     }
00700     else if (! isset($_SESSION["session_referer_domain"]))
00701     {
00702         /* No referer domain is yet saved in the session.  Save it. */
00703         $_SESSION["session_referer_domain"] = $refererDomain;
00704     }
00705 
00706     break;
00707 
00708 case Accessibility_Fail:
00709     $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_PermissionDenied,
00710                      "Permission Denied [6]");
00711     $error->SendAndExit();
00712     /* never gets here */
00713     break;
00714 
00715 default:
00716     /* Service's GetAccessibility() function returned a bogus value */
00717     $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_PermissionDenied,
00718                      "Service error: unknown accessibility.");
00719     $error->SendAndExit();
00720     /* never gets here */
00721 }
00722 
00723 /* Now that we've instantiated service, we should find the requested method */
00724 $method = "method_" . $jsonInput->method;
00725 if (! method_exists($service, $method))
00726 {
00727     $error->SetError(JsonRpcError_MethodNotFound,
00728                      "Method `" . $jsonInput->method . "` not found " .
00729                      "in service class `" .
00730                      $serviceComponents[count($serviceComponents) - 1] .
00731                      "`.");
00732     $error->SendAndExit();
00733     /* never gets here */
00734 }
00735 
00736 /* Errors from here on out will be Application-generated */
00737 $error->SetOrigin(JsonRpcError_Origin_Application);
00738 
00739 /* Call the requested method passing it the provided params */
00740 $output = $service->$method($jsonInput->params, $error);
00741 
00742 /* See if the result of the function was actually an error */
00743 if (get_class($output) == "JsonRpcError")
00744 {
00745     /* Yup, it was.  Return the error */
00746     $error->SendAndExit();
00747     /* never gets here */
00748 }
00749 
00750 /* Give 'em what they came for! */
00751 $ret = array("result" => $output,
00752              "id"     => $jsonInput->id);
00753 SendReply($json->encode($ret), $scriptTransportId);
00754 
00755 ?>
Generated on Mon Sep 17 22:43:09 2007 for qcl sample application by  1.5.3
